title: Architectural Model, "Temple of Vesta, Tivoli Architectural Model", 1810-1830
title_raw: Temple of Vesta, Tivoli Architectural Model
medium: pressed, carved, and cut cork with stained wood base
provenance: 2014, Acquired by Cooper Hewitt, Smithsonian Design Museum from Eugene V. Thaw and Clare E. Thaw, purchased Mallett's, London, ca 2010.
dimensions: H x diam.: 16 x 16 cm (6 5/16 x 6 5/16 in.) including base
creditline: Gift of Eugene V. and Clare E. Thaw
description: depicting the temple in its semi-ruined state as visible in the 18th and early nineteenth centuries, showing the circular section building with columns ringing a central core, supporting an upper moulding
